appDesc.message: Alter browser's built-in privacy settings in a toolbar popup

popupControllable.message: Red color means this preference is controlled by another extension. Privacy settings cannot alter it

popupPrivacy.message: Privacy status. Green means privacy is protected

popupSecurity.message: Security status. Green means security is protected

popupPeerDefault_public_and_private_inte.message: Reveal both public and private interfaces

network_networkPredictionEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome attempts to speed up your web browsing experience by pre-resolving DNS entries and preemptively opening TCP and SSL connections to servers. This preference only affects actions taken by Chrome's internal prediction service. It does not affect webpage-initiated prefectches or preconnects. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

network_webRTCIPHandlingPolicy.message: Allow users to specify the media performance/privacy tradeoffs which impacts how WebRTC traffic will be routed and how much local address information is exposed. This preference's value is of type IPHandlingPolicy, defaulting to default.

services_alternateErrorPagesEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome uses a web service to help resolve navigation errors. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

services_autofillEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome offers to automatically fill in forms. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

services_hotwordSearchEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome will enable 'OK, Google' to start a voice search. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

services_passwordSavingEnabled.message: If enabled, the password manager will ask if you want to save passwords. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

services_safeBrowsingEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome does its best to protect you from phishing and malware. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

services_safeBrowsingExtendedReportingEn.message: If enabled, Chrome will send additional information to Google when SafeBrowsing blocks a page, such as the content of the blocked page. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to false.

services_searchSuggestEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome sends the text you type into the Omnibox to your default search engine, which provides predictions of websites and searches that are likely completions of what you've typed so far. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

services_spellingServiceEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome uses a web service to help correct spelling errors. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to false.

services_translationServiceEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome offers to translate pages that aren't in a language you read. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

websites_firstPartyIsolate.message: If true, the firstPartyIsolate preference makes the browser associate all data (including cookies, HSTS data, cached images, and more) for any third party domains with the domain in the address bar. This prevents third party trackers from using directly stored information to identify the user across different websites, but may break websites where the user logs in with a third party account (such as a Facebook or Google account).

websites_thirdPartyCookiesAllowed.message: If disabled, Chrome blocks third-party sites from setting cookies. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

websites_hyperlinkAuditingEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome sends auditing pings when requested by a website (<a ping>). The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

websites_referrersEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome sends referer headers with your requests. Yes, the name of this preference doesn't match the misspelled header. No, we're not going to change it. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

websites_resistFingerprinting.message: If true, the browser report generic spoofed information for data that's commonly used for fingerprinting. Such data includes the number of CPU cores, precision of JavaScript timers, and the local timezone. It will also disable features that are used in fingerprinting, such as GamePad support, and the WebSpeech and Navigator APIs.

websites_protectedContentEnabled.message: If enabled, Chrome provides a unique ID to plugins in order to run protected content. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

websites_trackingProtectionMode.message: "Tracking protection" is a browser feature that blocks requests made to domains that are known to engage in cross-site tracking of users. Sites that track users are most commonly third-party advertising and analytics sites. This setting determines whether the browser should enable tracking protection or not on the normal and private modes
